citeinfo.origin: Joe R. Goodman, John H. Lincoln, Thomas G. Thompson, and Frederick A. Zeusler of the University of Washington, Seattle, Washington, USA.
citeinfo.title: Physical and Chemical Investigations: Bering Sea, Bering Strait, Chukchi Sea during the Summer of 1937 and 1938

abstract.p: This report is result of investigation made by the authors in northern and eastern Bering Sea and in the waters of the Arctic coast of Alaska (Chukchi Sea) during the summer of 1937 and 1938. These observations were made aboard the United States Coast Guard Cutter "NORTHLAND", Frederick A. Zeusler commanding, on its regular annual summer cruises into this area.

[Reference: Goodman, J.R., J.H. Lincoln, T.G. Thompson, and F.A. Zeusler. 1942. Physical and Chemical Investigations: Bering Sea, Bering Strait, Chukchi Sea during the Summer of 1937 and 1938. University of Washington Publications in Oceanography. Vol. 3, No. 4, pp. 105-169, and Appendix, pp. 1-117.]
This volume may be found at many university libraries.

descript.purpose: To report findings of the physical and chemical investigations in the Bering Sea, Bering Strait, and Chukchi Sea during the summer of 1937 and 1938.
